basics.name: Julia Youssef
basics.label: Geosciences & Paleobiology Researcher
basics.summary: Recent UChicago graduate working at the intersection of paleontology, quantitative modeling, and scientific illustration—reconstructing dynamic ecological systems through time.

work.name: University of Chicago — Slater Lab
work.summary: Developing quantitative frameworks linking mammalian molar morphology to herbivorous diet across extant and fossil taxa.
highlights: Built a standardized dataset of herbivore diets by assigning ranked importances to plant food items from primary literature.
Expanded methods from carnivore dietary ecology to herbivores, integrating keywords, rankings, and ecological guilds.
Applied PCA and clustering analyses to identify grazer–browser divisions, specialist guilds (e.g. frugivores), and dietary subniches.
Incorporated 3D molar surface metrics (e.g., OPCr, RFI, DNE) into Bayesian models to predict diet from morphology.
Developed a probabilistic framework to infer dietary niches in extinct mammals from fossil dentition.

work.name: University of Chicago — Honors Thesis
work.summary: Reanalysis of pterosaur phylogenies using parsimony and Bayesian FBD processes.
highlights: Performed an informal literature review of pterosaur crest morphology and phylogeny, particularly that of problem clades (anurognathidae), and quantitatively analyzed public morphological datasets.
Parsimony- and Bayesian-based trees were produced from these same datasets and compared with the goal of finding a consensus result amidst consistently competing hypotheses.
Evaluated stratigraphic congruence (e.g., GER, MSM*, RCI) and visualized uncertainty.
Gained experience in comparative cladistics and with popular paleontology packages like ape, strap, phytools, as well as programs like RevBayes, PAUP, TNT, and Mesquite.
Integrated data cleaning, version control, and figure generation (Python/R).

work.name: University of Chicago — Webster Lab
work.summary: Morphometric and character coding for Paleozoic trilobite disparity studies.
highlights: Cleaned, stained, and photographed dozens of mm-scale eodiscid trilobites.
Measured and coded discrete morphological traits.
Contributed to macroevolutionary datasets for use in biostratigraphy.

work.organization: Sereno Fossil Lab, University of Chicago
work.summary: Supported fossil preparation, collections work, and outreach in vertebrate paleontology, with additional field experience.
highlights: Prepared, stabilized vertebrate fossil specimens using established lab techniques.
Participated in fieldwork to Morrison, Cloverly formations at base of Bighorn Mountains, assisting with excavation, handling, and documentation of fossil material.
Contributed to collections care, cataloging, and rehousing of specimens.
Created paleoart and illustrations to support science communication and education, in addition to creating visualizations, diagrams, and casts for display, outreach, and donor gifts.
Engaged with the public during lab tours, presenting fossil preparation methods and evolutionary context.

work.name: UChicago Housing & Residence Life
highlights: Mentored 90+ residents; coordinated programming and crisis response.
Mediated conflicts and facilitated an inclusive residential environment.

work.summary: Contributed to computational cosmology research with a focus on CMB datasets, applying statistical and machine learning methods in an international collaboration.
highlights: Utilized simulation-based-inference to analyze the relationships between cosmological constraints, dark matter halos in galaxy clusters, and the observed SZ effect in the cosmic microwave background.

Used regression and classification machine learning techniques in Python in applications to cosmology and astrophysics, particularly gaining proficiency in GitHub and numpy, pandas, scipy, astropy, matplotlib, keras packages.
Used statistical astroinformatics approaches to integrate heterogeneous cosmology datasets for joint analysis.
Participated in presentation of research to members of Deep Skies and Fermilab.
Adapted experience with Bayesian and computational pipelines to later paleobiological modeling of evolutionary systems.

volunteer.name: UChicago Paleontology Club
volunteer.summary: Student leadership and outreach in paleontology.
highlights: Organized talks, field trips, and annual events.
Coordinated guest speakers and museum collaborations.

courses: Paleontology & Evolution: Phylogenetics and the Fossil Record
Paleontology & Evolution: Invertebrate Paleobiology and Evolution
Quantitative & Modeling: Intro to Python for Astrostatistics
Quantitative & Modeling: Computational Techniques in Astrophysics
Planetary & Astrophysics: What Makes a Planet Habitable?
Planetary & Astrophysics: Origin and Evolution of the Solar System
Art & Communication: Visual Language: On Images

publications.name: A Reanalysis of Recent Pterosaur Phylogenies through Parsimony and the Bayesian FBD Process
publications.summary: Comparative phylogenetic workflows in RevBayes/TNT with stratigraphic congruence evaluation.

projects.name: PBDB Fossil Data Pipeline
projects.summary: Python tools for querying, cleaning, and stratigraphically binning Paleobiology Database occurrences.
highlights: Taxonomic reconciliation
Specimen-level filters

projects.name: Scientific Illustration & Paleoart
projects.summary: Digital and traditional media for communicating paleobiology and earth history.
highlights: Soft pastels, pencil, digital
Portfolio integrated into site

projects.name: Severn Fellows Project
projects.summary: Funded independent fellowship project integrating paleontological research with scientific art.
highlights: Drafted and proposed an independent research project on theropod dinosaurs, including budgeting and planning.
Researched phylogeny, ecology, appearance, and anatomy of multiple theropod species.
Produced paleoart and a series of illustrated, data-informed pages for science communication.
